page.title: 19NELL BALL,POND AND GREEN.
page.content:
{,Nell Ball is a mound 88 metres high {on the edge of Plaistow. }It has a trig-point reference number 56254. The local legend is that{Nell Gwynn dances round the tree at the top. It is also said that fishermen and sailors near Littlehampton used the tree as a guide.
{The Village Pond}has a spring and never dries up. Steps lead down into the pond, once used on washing days. A slope leads into the pond where cattle drank and where dirty carts were washed.
{The Village Green}has a roundabout and swings given by{Lord Wilson}who lived nearby. In May time children dance round the{Maypole}and a lamb is cooked on a spit and fair games are held.
